arm_group.description: Collect blood and other optional biospecimens from participants with a diagnosed health condition
Collect blood and other optional biospecimens from participants that have not been diagnosed with a health condition

biospec_descr.textblock:
Whole blood, serum, plasma, PBMC, RNA, DNA, saliva, stool, hair, skin, CSF, synovial fuid,
      tumor tissue, urine

brief_summary.textblock:
At Sanguine Biosciences, we consider ourselves the bridge between patients like you and
      researchers striving to find the cure. We collect blood and/or tissue samples and in-depth
      profiles for medical researchers. Donate from your home, track your sample, and help
      specialists get the information they need to advance medical research.

clinical_study.brief_title: Be the Bridge Between Researchers and a Cure (ALS, Hepatitis B, Melanoma, Alzheimer's Disease, Leukemia, and More)

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will collect blood and other optionally donated tissue samples from people with
      all different types of health conditions, as well as healthy control samples, in order to
      provide biomedical researchers with quality biospecimens that are necessary in translating
      basic science research into clinically relevant information and technology.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All adults 18-100 years old

          -  Able to provide proof of diagnosis

          -  Live in USA

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Younger than 18 years old

          -  Receipt of blood products within 30 days of study blood collection

          -  Receipt of investigational drug within 30 days of study blood collection

clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Site Tissue Repository Providing Annotated Biospecimens for Approved Investigator-Directed Biomedical Research Initiatives

primary_outcome.description: To collect enough biospecimens and associated clinical data to allow researchers to come to statistically relevant scientific results

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
